data.title: Great Sushi!
data.text: Yoshi's recently changed owners. The food and service are  better than ever. The sushi is high quality and very fresh. I can't wait to get back to this Yorba Linda gem!

data.title: not as good as the previous owners
data.text: Yoshi's was a pretty regular spot for us to dine until the new owners took over I am sorry to say. The service and the food suffered for the change. The fish was NOT as fresh. The service was not as attentive. The food was not as attractive. If they were the only Japanese and Sushi restaurant around I would probably still go there from time to time but it was not the treat it once was and there are other better choices. There was a great chef there who left just prior to the buy out and I hear he is back now. I might try again. Look for an updated review.

data.title: Repeat customer
data.text: We eat here at least twice a month, have been for several years. Never have been disappointed and vary our selections.

data.title: Under New Management... Trying Hard to be Japanese?
data.text:
Food - 1 (fusion) not fresh tasting
Price - $$ but not worth it!?
Ambience - 2 (think 60's kung-fu movie)
Service - 3 open less than a week, so they're trying.

Under New Management. If you're looking for Japanese food this is not a good choice. If you're looking for a Korean fusion Japanese food, you still might take a pass.  Maybe rename it Minjun's? Yoshi, here'd you go?

data.title: Japanese Food artfully & carefully prepared to please the palate.
data.text:
I have eaten at Yoshi's for many years & have never been disappointed.  The service is friendly and prompt.  While I do not eat Sushi, friends tell me that their Sushi is very good.
Meals for both Lunch & Dinner are fairly priced.

data.title: *** Yoshi's sold to new owners****
data.text:
I was sad to hear from the previous owners that they have retired and a new owners have taken over.  I will miss Su and Ken, I have been coming to their restaurant for almost 20 years.  They have watched my son grow up over the years. The food is was the best and the sushi even better.
I hope the new owners don't change a thing.  Good luck in your retirement!

data.title: Really great fresh and unique rolls
data.text: Had dinner here just this past Friday.  I can't remember the names of the rolls we ordered but they were really good.  We ate at the bar which means you cannot order from the regular menu.  Only sushi (and drinks of course).  One thing that is a little disconcerting is having a menu that has no pricing at all.  So yes while the food is great you have to at least have some idea as to how much you are going to be spending.  Otherwise indigestion sets in after you get the bill.

data.title: You'd think we are family
data.text: My family and I are very big into the Asian culture, specifically Japanese. Having been to Japan numerous times, we are also kind of Japanese food snobs. That being said, Yoshi's is great because it fits the mold as a great Japanese restaurant. The food is as authentic as it gets, along with the "Americanized" style of sushi such as different rolls with names (ex: Yorba Linda Roll, Dragon Roll) there is definitely something for everyone to eat here, and the price is right too! The best part about eating at Yoshi's as that they treat you like family. Yoshi and his wife "Mama San" always greet my me and my family by name and treat us as if we are her own family. We have had graduation dinners, birthday celebrations, friends from out of town (including Japan), and business meetings here. It is great for any type of dinner, casual, nicer, date, group, celebratory...they are the right place!

data.title: A Tradition of Providing GREAT Sushi
data.text: My wife and I have been going to Yoshi's for over 15 years. Besides the great food, one of the most enduring aspects of Yoshi (and his wife) is -- no matter how long it's been since my last visit, they always remember my name!! That makes me feel instantly like a valued family member coming home for a meal. Beyond that, I have to agree that they have the freshest seafood, the most friendly and creative sushi chefs and a general atmosphere that exudes warmth and hospitality. We've been going so long that we could get into a rut ordering the same thing (and sometimes we do) but the fun is in just putting ourselves into the hands of Yoshi or Louie and letting them suggest things like fresh sardines, Louie's favorite Uni salad and, of course, the Lobster roll. This is one of the great sushi places on the planet. Give it a try!

data.title: Great Japanese Family Sushi / Food!
data.text:
I have been to tons of Japanese restaurants, yet I highly recommend Yoshi's Sushi restaurant as #1 rating.
The reasons of recommendation of this restaurant are following:
1. Most Fresh Fishes are served here
2. Very reasonable
3. Good for family dining
4. Chef Yoshi was trained in Japan and he has advanced skill of making sushi
5. Today's specials are tasty
6. Service is oustanding!
I've been coming here for years and I love it even to this day. The husband and wife who own this restaurant work really hard to provide quality food and excellent service. If you don't know what to order...

Things that I always get:

- poki bowl - the best i've ever had, hands-down
- baked butterfish - miso glazed so it's juicy and tasty
- tonkatsu salad
- lobster handroll - one of my favs
- YL roll - a unique roll served with smoked salmon, delicious!
- nabeyaki udon - yummy and soothing
- hamachi sashimi - the best!
- yosenabe - filled with veggies and seafood in a light broth
- seafood salad roll - yummmm
- sukiyaki
- kawasaki roll - delicious!
- california roll - seriously so good here!

Seriously, everything is so good and the quality is amazing. They have the best hamachi sashimi in this area. It's sweet, fresh and tastes how yellowtail should.

The service has always been very good and consistent. You can tell they really appreciate your business and strive to make you happy! Yoshi's always bring back good memories!
I believe the owner of restaurant always does her best to serve most dainty Japanese cuisine. My family and I always stop in when were are in CA.  We have been coming here for years!  Try it you wil be glad you did!

data.title: Great Sushi
data.text: Both my husband and I have gone to this restaurant for years and truly enjoyed the sushi.  The service is excellent.  Highly recommend going to this little restaurant if you want excellent servings of sushi and service.  We'll definitely return.

data.title: Great Sushi and Friendly Staff!
data.text: Yoshi's Restaurant has excellent sushi and a friendly staff!  The Ahi Ahi roll was incredible!!  It tasted so fresh.  We will definitely be back!

data.title: Real Japanese Sushi
data.text: We come to this place at least a couple of times a month, and the fish is always fresh and the sushi chefs take good care of us.

data.title: Excellent Food...when it arrives:(
data.text: Excellent food, very fresh sushi, everything had great flavor. The only problem is having one server who runs around like a chicken with her head cut off. The place is small  but nice and if you are just going to have sushi I strongly recommend you sit at the sushi bar otherwise you may be served the wrong thing and it will take forever to get it...I would go again, but would sit at the bar.

data.title: really good sushi in YL
data.text: top quality fish, wide assortment of sushi, sashimi, and cooked entrees. friendly people. its a winner.

data.title: Good eats!
data.text: Great service every time, friendly environment and good prices

data.title: Not bad if your regular sushi bar isn't open
data.text:
I'd say the other food here is better than their sushi.
However not bad by any means.
Chefs can be kinda rude at times...especially the owner.

data.title: Wow! (By Sister Fuss)
data.text:
Yet another hidden Japanese restaurant in Yorba Linda I found while dining with friends! But this isn't just your average restaurant- Yoshi's, with its delicious sushi and great value, tops my list for Japanese restaurants in the area. I never tried sushi before, but thanks to my experience here, I can tell it's the first of many!

The restaurant itself is fairly large, with plenty of tables and a full-on sushi bar. It is also well-lit and spacious. Our party was seated immediately and served vinegar-tasting cucumbers and coleslaw as complimentary appetizers, which were pretty good. The service continued to be efficient throughout our meal, although we had to keep asking for drink refills.

I ordered a lunch special with terriyaki chicken and tempura ($5.75), which was a great deal, since it also came with miso soup, rice, salad, orange slices, and potato salad, served on a large plate. Everyone else enjoyed their food, too. But the sushi was what was truly excellent! We had several orders to share, including crunchy rolls (heavenly!) and spicy tuna rolls (which I didn't try because I'm still leery of raw fish), and a sampler. I tried the crunchy rolls and the California rolls, both of which I loved.

So come to Yoshi's! It's a great place for a first-time sushi experience, and I think tried and true sushi lovers will enjoy it as well. Yummo!

data.title: Amazing
data.text:
Super ótimo atendimento
Sushi chef excelente 
Ótimas opções de sakê e boa cerveja japonesa
Sempre tem algo diferente como sushi de polvo ou caranguejo fresco
Minha sobrinha de 6 anos ama este restaurante
